clinical_study.brief_title: Acupuncture to Prevent Postoperative Bowel Paralysis (Paralytic Ileus)
clinical_study.official_title: Acupuncture to Prevent Postoperative Paralytic Ileus

lead_sponsor.agency: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

clinical_study.source: National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health (NCCIH)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if acupuncture is effective in preventing prolonged postoperative paralysis of the gastrointestinal tract among patients undergoing colostomy/ileostomy closure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgical cancer treatment with ileostomy/colostomy, now scheduled for closure
- Hospital admission must be same day as surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incapacitating disease
- Concurrent herbal or laxative use
- Use of Heparin or Coumadin
- Upper or lower extremity deformities
- Chronic constipation prior to cancer diagnosis
- History of cerebrovascular accident or spinal cord injury
- Chronic pain that has been treated with any form of major opioid or weak opioids (=/> 30mg/24 hours)
- Pacemaker or metal implants
- Concurrent alternative medicine/herbal use
